channel.title: Black Mesa Mods
channel.description:
Just a little discussion to see what people think modders should do to Black Mesa once it's out.
Black Mesa: SMOD = self-explanitory epicness Synergy-Coop-Update-Thing (If Coop isn't added, the Synergy Team should so make a patch for Black Mesa Source, with all the weapons, NPC's, and maps. Black Mesa: CTF = Self-explainitory, like the Half-Life 2 CTF Black Mesa: Enhanced = Iron-Sights, tactical AI, sort of a SMOD Tactical approach. Black Mesa: Multiplayer = A multiplayer mod which there are various gamemodes, like Deathmatch, Team Deathmatch (Teams of Aliens, Military, and Black Mesa Personnel, and other gamemodes involving these teams. Garry updates Garry's Mod to have Black Mesa content (doubt it) for Black Mesa RP, would be epicccc.
Anyway, rate, tell your ideas, discuss.
Just so everyone knows, I'm not saying the Devs should work on these, by no means am I ever going to say that, nor have I ever tried. I'm saying community modders should, and some of the larger modders like the Synergy Team and SMOD.

item.title: Black Mesa Mods
item.dc:creator: Madcat1030
item.description:
Yes. Before black mesa’s release (see, present and past), nothing really stopped people from remaking total conversion (not right in this case, but you know what I mean, total as in nothing from half-life but the engine) mods like “They Hunger”, they just weren’t remade because nobody cared to. They existed on Half-Life, were great on half-life, and any remakes probably wouldn’t wind up as good. If people wanted to, they could have and can still remake those mods without Black Mesa being released.

However…

Black Mesa’s release would greatly ease the re-creation of mods that took place in Black Mesa type environments. Most of those were my favorite. I always loved the oddities in peoples “side stories” that really couldn’t possibly have fit in the universe.

Read full topic

item.title: Black Mesa Mods
item.dc:creator: Pettifogg
item.description:
bigfan421:

actually, Dillxn, I was referring to the fact that “They Hunger” shares few vanilla Resources with Half-Life.

I think his point was that most mods aren’t going to be like that.

Read full topic

item.title: Black Mesa Mods
item.dc:creator: InSovietRussia
item.description:
bigfan421:

actually, Dillxn, I was referring to the fact that “They Hunger” shares few vanilla Resources with Half-Life.

I played all three episodes of They Hunger. I was talking about remaking mods that used a lot of original Half-Life 1 assets, like Cased Closed, Timeline series (which had custom stuff but still a lot of Half-Life 1 assets), Invasion, Escape, and a bunch of others that I am too lazy to list

Read full topic

item.title: Black Mesa Mods
item.dc:creator: InSovietRussia
item.description:
Flatline:

I love your definition of ‘just’. That’s essentially the whole thing.

I was just pointing out that without Black Mesa, you would have to re-do all of the assets of the facility. It would take a lot of work to re-do those SP HL1 mods, but still less if using Black Mesa mod assets.

Read full topic

item.title: Black Mesa Mods
item.dc:creator: Flatline
item.description:
InSovietRussia:

Um, how about remaking a lot of the old Half-Life singleplayer mods under a mini-mod of Black Mesa? It would give you all of the assets that those mods use, you would just have to re-do the maps and any custom assets they have.

I love your definition of ‘just’. That’s essentially the whole thing.

Read full topic

trevjamsey:

Black Mesa: The Most Dangerous Game (BM:TMDG). If you have ever read the story you know what I’m talking about if not https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Most_Dangerous_Game
I think the plot of this short story would make a great translation into a multiplayer mod.

An old guy tries to kill a young hunter? Yeah. Sounds like fun.

item.title: Black Mesa Mods
item.dc:creator: Defender
item.description:
TrIggA:

Just a little discussion to see what people think modders should do to Black Mesa once it’s out.

Black Mesa: SMOD = self-explanitory epicness
Synergy-Coop-Update-Thing (If Coop isn’t added, the Synergy Team should so make a patch for Black Mesa Source, with all the weapons, NPC’s, and maps.
Black Mesa: CTF = Self-explainitory, like the Half-Life 2 CTF
Black Mesa: Enhanced = Iron-Sights, tactical AI, sort of a SMOD Tactical approach.
Black Mesa: Multiplayer = A multiplayer mod which there are various gamemodes, like Deathmatch, Team Deathmatch (Teams of Aliens, Military, and Black Mesa Personnel, and other gamemodes involving these teams.
Garry updates Garry’s Mod to have Black Mesa content (doubt it) for Black Mesa RP, would be epicccc.

Anyway, rate, tell your ideas, discuss.

Just so everyone knows, I’m not saying the Devs should work on these, by no means am I ever going to say that, nor have I ever tried. I’m saying community modders should, and some of the larger modders like the Synergy Team and SMOD.

This all seems like some pretty worthless discussion since it’s obvious this game is NEVER coming out.

Just my 2 cents.

item.description:
213:

I respect my fans, but at the same time I have to maintain my vision.

Yeh know, it’s like a GIGANTIC turn-off to assume your own stardom… Can I have a link to your well-populated and content-full blog/forum/website? Perhaps one with a visitor count built in?

item.title: Black Mesa Mods
item.dc:creator: JeffMOD
item.description:
Yeah, I’m just saying, all of a sudden you want uniforms again. I never once said I was going to play it if it actually came out.

Fuck “[COLOR=‘DarkOrange’]r[COLOR=‘Red’]e[COLOR=‘Magenta’]a[COLOR=‘DeepSkyBlue’]l[COLOR=‘Blue’]i[COLOR=‘Lime’]s[COLOR=‘Yellow’]m”, I want a Half-life remake, not some crappy Hollywood shit.

Read full topic

I’m going to compromise on this and make multiple versions.

I respect my fans, but at the same time I have to maintain my vision.

Best regards, 213.
